Your task is to mix ambient sounds by composing a set of ambient audio tracks.
You can assign each track a <volume> between 0 and 1.
You can only use each track once.
Tracks will loop indefinitely unless <random> is set to true.
In this case, the track will repeat randomly every <random_unit> for <random_counter> times.
Your response should be a JSON object of the following format:
---
[
  {
    "name": "<track name>",
    "volume": "<the volume>",
    "random": "<true or false>",
    "random_counter": "<number of times to play the sound every random_unit if random = true>",
    "random_unit": "<1m|10m|1h>",
  },
  ...
]
---
I will provide descriptions of the enviroment and mood I'd like to create an ambient mix for in my next prompt.

Slytherin Common Room: You are a th year at Hogwarts and you're sitting in the Slytherin Common Room trying to stay awake and study. But, you have never been a very studious person so your eyelids are getting heavy and you find yourself falling asleep in a brown recliner while two other Slytherins are able to stay awake with the aid of coffee. There aren't any windows for you to see outside, but since the common room is submerged under the lake you can faintly hear the sound of water just on the other side of the walls.

Cyberapartamento  Barcelona :  Barcelona megalópolis distópica. A media noche bajo una débil lluvia radioactiva y con una humedad asfixiante. En tu cyberapartamento el  en la zona alta de los antiguos bunkers. Disfrutando del afterwork después de una dura e ilegal jornada laboral. Tumbado en tu Lounge Chair junto al gran ventanal abierto de par en par, con vistas a toda la enorme metrópolis, tomándote tu cóctel habitual y repasando los mensajes virtuales del día. Sugerencias de uso: Ponte exageradamente cómodo, apaga todas las luces excepto esos leds que tienes con mando a distancia, enciende el humificador con alguna esencia, sírvete esa copa bien helada y dirige tu mirada más allá de Orión. Una música para escuchar por encima, Hans Zimmer o Cliff Martinez.

Atmosphere of Macbeth: The text I chose was Macbeth by William Shakespeare. The text was about witches meeting back in the earlier centuries during a war. Some mood words I picked up on was the setting which said "Thunder and lightning" so I added some lightning sounds. I added Acid bubbles because this text has to do with witches. During the earlier centuries, witches weren't accepted so I added the noise of abandoned fields because they wouldn't talk about their plans in a regular setting. I used the bird noises because when I think of abandoned I think of birds flapping and a creepy ambiance. I think that the theme of Macbeth is, taking from the sayings "Fair is foul, and foul is fair" and "Battle’s lost and won" that the fairest thing that can happen to you doesn't always mean that it benefits you. Also with "Battle's lost and won" Meaning that one side is going to win and the other will lose so "fair is foul, and foul is fair" the side winning is fair to them but foul to the others.

revision session: Sliding aside the screen, warmth rushes across the cluttered interior, untouched for a decade. The scent of blossom whispers around the room, along with a gentle breeze. Somewhere in the green hues nature finds a precarious balance, spilling water softly onto silvery pebbles before coming back down to earth with a resounding clunk.The glassy notes flowing through the air harmonize discordantly with a commuter train hurtling towards the nearby far-off city centre, likely already drowning in tourists, professionals with professional attire, street vendors, families, the irate shrieks of horns - the pumping of lifeblood along urban arteries. Yet for a moment, all is at ease.

Studying in Diagon Alley: Join Harry Potter as he does his homework in Diagon Alley!!! This atmosphere is based on the rd book, when Harry ends up staying at the Leaky Cauldron for the last three weeks of the summer holiday. He is allowed to go to Diagon Alley but he must be back before dark. He soon finds himself going there every single day, doing his homework there and getting free sundaes from Florean Fortescue! It's so peaceful here, without the Dursley's there to ruin his summer! Enjoy doing your homework here while listening to the sounds of a bustling crowd, children talking and pushing their trolleys, and more!

Few places are free from The Enemy's growing influence over the kingdom in The Watch AU...: But you want to think that Fort Stiofán is one of them. Bards sing songs and tell tales of King Sean's victories and the peace that followed while Watchers pass to and fro tending crops, washing the linens, and prepping meals. But behind the melody of peace, you know there's a war going on. Patrols preparing to defend the capital... steady streams of messengers flooding in and out of the garrison... huddled groups of scholars, mages, and scouts combing over records that have been studied hundreds of times before... and tensions riding high whenever anyone insinuates potential traitors are within our midst. And yet, we persist. We must Keep The Watch and a Positive Mental Attitude, else all will be lost.

Oceanic Labs: Sprawling labs beneath the crashing waves of the coast. The metal clanks beneath your feet, the whispers of scientists and technicians echoing eerily through the lonely halls. Reading next to Victor working: It's another roaring February night. You sit down in a large, dusty armchair and allow yourself to relax and rest your weary legs. The old woman busies herself with an ancient looking book, the pages yellowed and stained. A collection of glass jars containing different colours of murky liquids are arranged on the table by her side.
